Docs.summary: Provides data for a cancelable event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A cancelable event is raised by a component when it is about to perform an action that can be canceled, such as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Closing> event of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Closing> event is deprecated and has been replaced by <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.FormClosing>. It is offered as an example here only to illustrate the usage of CancelEventArgs.
CancelEventArgs provides the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property to indicate whether the event should be canceled.
## Examples The following example uses CancelEventArgs and a <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventHandler> to handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Closing> event of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>. This code assumes that you have created a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> with a class-level <xref:System.Boolean> variable named `isDataSaved`. It also assumes that you have added a statement to invoke the `OtherInitialize` method from the form's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> method or the constructor (after the call to `InitializeComponent`).
